metadata.topic_title: Convergence of IT and OT security controls

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In the context of IT/OT convergence, debate whether prioritizing IT's CIA triad over OT's safety and availability could lead to catastrophic failures. Use examples from NIST SP 800-82r3 to support your position. (Encourages critical thinking and addresses misconceptions that IT controls directly apply to OT.)
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

layer.name: Layer 1
layer.content: Define IT (data processing, CIA triad), OT (ICS/SCADA/DCS, safety/availability priority), IT/OT convergence (IIoT-driven merging), attack surface expansion. Prior knowledge: CIA triad, basic networking, ICS intro.

layer.name: Layer 2
layer.content: Key frameworks: NIST SP 800-82r3 (OT security guide: asset mgmt, network seg, access ctrl); NIST CSF 2.0 (Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover functions applied to IT/OT); IEC 62443 (industrial automation security). Differences: IT emphasizes confidentiality; OT prioritizes availability/safety.

layer.name: Layer 3
layer.content: Step-by-step: 1. Assess IT/OT assets (inventory, criticality). 2. Map controls (NIST 800-82 overlay on CSF). 3. Implement segmentation (network zoning, Purdue model). 4. Monitor with OT-safe tools (passive scanning).

layer.name: Layer 4
layer.content: Zero-trust architecture in converged envs; AI/ML for anomaly detection (OT-specific); unified policy mgmt; case studies (e.g., Stuxnet lessons); future: secure IIoT ecosystems for digital transformation.
